item.title: Git Branching Strategies
item.description: In a previous post, I talked about git workflows and I outlined the two big problems I see with git workflows: Pull Requests/Reviews Branching Strategies I took the easy route at the time and just talked about Pull Requests/Reviews. But I was requested to throw some thoughts out around branching strategies and how they should work. The reason I think branching strategies are such a complicated topic is because it touches more than just git.

item.title: Git Workflows Suck
item.description: I’m tired of all the git workflows. I’m tired of talking about the best way to craft commit messages. I’m tired of how people pile on the best way to do PRs. I’m sick of people picking apart architectural decisions in a PR. I’m tired of opening PRs only to have no one look at them for days while I continue to harass people into reviews. I’m over the fact that I don’t think I’ve ever seen a single person clone a PR locally and actually verify that it does what it says it does.
